children.subject: Heres a comprehensive prereq graph. https://hkn.eecs.berkeley.edu/courseguides I cannot recommend skipping any of the prerequisites. CS is just like math, with upper divs building off of lower divs. Imagine trying to do math1b, let alone math 104/113/110, as your first math class after precalc. It would probably be a waste of your time - really really hard and you wouldnt get much out of it. If you can take 61a/b, that opens up most of the upper divs for you. Why do you want to do cs cluster? Can you fit these two lower divs into your schedule?

I would venture to say (and some may passionately dissagree) but if you reeeally can't fit both 61a/b in your schedule and if you have some basic Python/R programming from your stats classes, then in your situation you could probably skip out on 61a and take 61b (maybe after honing some basic Java skills), because 61b is perhaps the "hallmark" of developing good CS programming skills through large projects, and then open your door to some systems classes like 186 or 161 on top of the more mathy 17x/188 classes you would probably already be decently prepared for.

Some context: which of the 61 series have you taken? What is your programming background? AFAIK, most of the above don't enforce prereqs, and I think 189 enforced prereqs once cause it was overful and not webcasted.
I'm Stats and CS double and from my experience, if you haven't taken any 61 series, I recommend you take them first, at least 61A and B before you take any CS Upper div classes.

For CS161 (security), my prerequisite test is:

a)  Can you learn a new programming language quickly (e.g. if I shove go at you, can you pick it up with absolutely 0 handholding)

b)  For the 61C prerequisite: read "Smashing the stack for fun and profit".  If that makes sense, cool, you meet the prerequisites.
168 doesn't really rely on any course, assuming that you know how to program

history.content:
Hi all. I'm a statistics major and was hoping to do the CS cluster as part of my major requirements. I've taken Math 53, 54 and Stat 133, 134, 135. Besides 189, are there any classes from this list:

Computer Science: C149, 152, 160, 161, 162, 164, 168, 169, 170, 172, 176, 182*, 184, 186, W186, 188, 189*

that I can take? Will their prereqs be reinforced?
history.subject: Upper Div CS classes without prereq enforcement
